title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 358-3.3 - Benefits less favorable with respect to certain employees eligible under a plan
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 358-3.3 - Benefits less favorable with respect to certain employees eligible under a plan

State Regulations

If the benefits under a plan, other than a plan under
subdivision (a) or paragraph (2) of subdivision (b) of section
358-1.1
of this Part, do not meet
the requirements of section
358-3.1
of this Subpart as to any
class of employees eligible for such benefits, but do meet such requirements as
to another class or other classes of employees, the plan may be accepted under
section
211
of the Workers' Compensation Law with respect to the class or classes of
employees as to whom the benefits provided do meet the requirements of section
358-3.1
of this Subpart. The
employer may provide statutory benefits for the class or classes of employees
for whom the plan benefits do not meet the requirements of section
358-3.1
of this Subpart, or may
supplement the plan benefits by another plan, in order that the benefits
provided for all employees entitled to benefits under the plan shall meet the
requirements of section 358- 3.1 of this Subpart. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
358-3.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
